Gaza: As UN declares famine, Israel condemns what it calls an antisemitic campaign
subhead: A report published Friday confirms a major food crisis, with more than 500,000 Gazans already facing famine. This situation is the result of prolonged periods of blockade. The Israeli government disputes these accusations and Benjamin Netanyahu dismisses them as antisemitic prejudice.

title: Spike in suspicious incidents in Iran fuels fears of a simmering war
Ukraine must 'turn time to its advantage' against Putin
A controversial FBI search at John Bolton's home and office
subhead: The investigation targeting Trump's former national security adviser, now a fierce critic of the US president, has fueled suspicions that the justice system is being weaponized by the White House.

title: Former French PM Gabriel Attal wants to end surrogacy 'taboo'
subhead: The support he brings to the divisive issue – surrogacy is illegal in France – sets the former prime minister apart from the conservative right and the hesitations of the left.

title: The mysteries of actress Isabelle Adjani's vocation
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (1/6). Nothing seemed to predestine her to become one of the greatest stars of French cinema. Yet the young actress, born to an Algerian father and a German mother, experienced a meteoric rise. She made her debut on stage at barely 17 years old and quickly transitioned to film.

title: Being a writer in an age of digital omnipresence: James Baldwin 'seemed free in ways we sense we no longer can be'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (6/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams envies the great American author's bohemian, technology-free existence, despite the chaos it represented.

How the 2024 Olympics transformed Greater Paris into a supersized stadium
subhead: Previously unpublished data on visitor numbers in Paris and its suburbs during the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games reveal how the city and its residents adapted, and how the Games accelerated Paris's transformation.

title: In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
subhead: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

title: In 'Kolkhoze,' Emmanuel Carrère becomes his mother's son
subhead: In his new book, the French author reflects on his often tumultuous relationship with his late mother, Hélène Carrère d'Encausse, and explores what he owes her. This major work addresses themes of death, love and writing.
